intro: Angraecum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed star orchid, is a species of orchid native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and striking white flowers with prominent violet markings. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by hawkmoths, which are attracted to its nectar and specialized floral structure. Angraecum lanceolatum is a rare and delicate species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
